p: We report for the first time anti‐ Toxoplasma activity of Dracocephalum kotschyi, in vitro, and in vivo. The results obtained in this study attribute to the essential oil of D. kotschyi, inhibitory activity against T. gondii, without toxicity to the host. It can be assumed that the mechanism of action of the essential oil against T. gondii is associated with the mitochondrial function of T. gondii. The essential oil of D. kotschyi has an interesting pharmacological potential to be valued in the fight against toxoplasmosis. Supplementary works are necessary to identify actives compounds associated with anti‐ Toxoplasma activity.
